name: URigVMNode
doc:
The Node represents a single statement within a Graph.
Nodes can represent values such as Variables / Parameters,
they can represent Function Invocations or Control Flow
logic statements (such as If conditions of For loops).
Additionally Nodes are used to represent Comment statements.
Nodes contain Pins to represent parameters for Function
Invocations or Value access on Variables / Parameters.

methods.name: CanBeUpgraded
methods.doc: returns true if the node can be upgraded

methods.name: CanOnlyExistOnce
methods.doc: Returns true if this node can only exist once in a graph

methods.name: FindPin
methods.doc:
Returns a Pin given it's partial pin path below
this node (for example: "Color.R")

methods.name: GetAllPinsRecursively
methods.doc: Returns all of the Pins of this Node (including SubPins).

methods.name: GetEventName
methods.doc: Returns the name of the event

methods.name: GetGraph
methods.doc: Returns the Graph of this Node

methods.name: GetGraphDepth
methods.doc: Returns the graph nesting depth of this node

methods.name: GetInjectionInfo
methods.doc: Returns the injection info of this Node (or nullptr)

methods.name: GetLinkedSourceNodes
methods.doc:
Returns a list of Nodes connected as sources to
this Node as the target.

methods.name: GetLinkedTargetNodes
methods.doc:
Returns a list of Nodes connected as targets to
this Node as the source.

methods.name: GetLinks
methods.doc: Returns all links to any pin on this node

methods.name: GetNodeColor
methods.doc: Returns the color of this node - used for UI.

methods.name: GetNodeIndex
methods.doc: Returns the current index of the Node within the Graph.

methods.name: GetNodePath
methods.doc:
Returns the a . separated string containing all of the
names used to reach this Node within the Graph.
(for now this is the same as the Node's name)

methods.name: GetNodeTitle
methods.doc: Returns the title of this Node - used for UI.

methods.name: GetOrphanedPins
methods.doc: Returns all of the top-level orphaned Pins of this Node.

methods.name: GetPins
methods.doc: Returns all of the top-level Pins of this Node.

methods.name: GetPosition
methods.doc: Returns the 2d position of this node - used for UI.

methods.name: GetPreviousFName
methods.doc: Returns the name of the node prior to the renaming

methods.name: GetRootGraph
methods.doc: Returns the top level / root Graph of this Node

methods.name: GetSize
methods.doc: Returns the 2d size of this node - used for UI.

methods.name: GetSupportedWorkflows
methods.doc: returns all supported workflows of the node

methods.name: GetToolTipText
methods.doc: Returns the tooltip of this node

methods.name: HasInputPin
methods.doc: Returns true if the node has any input pins

methods.name: HasIOPin
methods.doc: Returns true if the node has any io pins

methods.name: HasLazyPin
methods.doc: Returns true if the node has any lazily evaluating pins

methods.name: HasOrphanedPins
methods.doc: Returns true if the node has orphaned pins - which leads to a compiler error

methods.name: HasOutputPin
methods.doc: Returns true if the node has any output pins

methods.name: HasPinOfDirection
methods.doc: Returns true if the node has any pins of the provided direction

methods.name: IsControlFlowNode
methods.doc: return true if this node is a control flow node

methods.name: IsDefinedAsConstant
methods.doc: Returns true if the node is defined as non-varying

methods.name: IsDefinedAsVarying
methods.doc: Returns true if the node is defined as non-varying

methods.name: IsEvent
methods.doc: Returns true if this Node is the beginning of a scope

methods.name: IsInjected
methods.doc:
Returns true if this is an injected node.
Injected nodes are managed by pins are are not visible to the user.

methods.name: IsLinkedTo
methods.doc:
Returns true if this Node is linked to another
given node through any of the Nodes' Pins.

methods.name: IsLoopNode
methods.doc: return true if this node is a loop node

methods.name: IsMutable
methods.doc:
Returns true if this Node has side effects or
internal state.

methods.name: IsPure
methods.doc:
Returns true if this Node has no side-effects
and no internal state.

methods.name: IsSelected
methods.doc: Returns true if this Node is currently selected.

methods.name: IsVisibleInUI
methods.doc: Returns true if this should be visible in the UI
